summary: The document is a SECRET memorandum from the CIA's Cover & Commercial Staff, dated 19 May 1976. It details the Agency's historical use of a company as a cover for CIA officers from 1961 to 1968, referencing a specific review staff memorandum (BS-76-0421/A). It also notes the service periods of two Agency officers under this cover, with one serving from 1961 to 1968 and another from 1953 to July 1962 before leaving the Agency. This document was released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
key_findings: CIA officers operated under the cover of a company from 1961 to 1968.
One officer served under this cover from 1961 to 1968, and another from 1953 to July 1962 before leaving the Agency.
The document is part of the records released under the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992.
keywords: John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Act of 1992
